episodes.title: Cult teaches folks inside to use self cues #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #mindcontrol
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture, mind control & self cues. If you are also a cult torture survivor or you are working with or love someone who is, did you know that there are self cues to set off mind control messages? Cult trained some folks inside through repeated torture to use those cues on us. It helps to notice the body language that we are using on ourselves and then to notice when we start spiraling into messages to not look at our memories, to silence us, to not believe ourselves, such as  suddenly and repeatedly thinking that we made it all up, that none of it's true, etc.

 I have had folks inside recently trying to stop me from looking at memories, and one of the things that they do as a self-cue is to slide our hand or two fingers and thumb down our eyes and face. If you think of where that comes from, how often people close someone's eyelids who has died, it is very symbolic. You may find that you have similar self cues as well. 

It helps me to notice and to pay attention when someone inside does that, and when the old mind control messages start to come back at us. While I have empathy for them because they were taught this through torture I want to interrupt it and change their job over time because mind control is only to benefit the cult and hurt us. So it helps me to notice and pay attention when it is happening. I hope this helps you, too. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #mindcontrol #plural #dissociativeidentitydisorder

episodes.title: TW: cult torture. My naturopath & student make accommodations for me that help #ramcoasurvivor
The cult intentionally overwhelmed us on a sensory level for torture #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor
The cult created cues out of everyday sights & phrases for a specific programming #ramcoasurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, mind control. The cults that tortured me were very intentional in creating cues based on everyday objects, phrases, sights, sounds that we would encounter regularly to trigger off mind control that would benefit the cult, such as keeping us silent, doubting ourselves, hurting ourselves if we were not still being tortured by the cult, etc. For me it helps to recognize the cue and the message that goes with it, to take it back down to the memory, and to give those folks inside to hold those cues the opposite messages and remind them that the cult lied and that we want to be the opposite of the cult and they can be, too. It also helps to hear those positive messages from outside people. #mindcontrol #ramcoa #cultsurvivor #traumatok

episodes.title: Part of what allows cults to continue is money and power #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture. The cults that tortured me that my parents and extended family were a part of - intergenerational, interconnected KKK, Nazi, and Satanic - had a lot of money, power, and influence and I think that is part of what allows them to continue, along with the deliberate mind control and elaborate abuse scenarios they use to silence survivors and make us doubt themselves. They gained a lot of money from the trafficking of us as kids, teens, even adults, and from the trafficking where they taught people to torture, and from the child p0rn0gràphy, and sales of guns and drugs. 

But there is also the positions of power they have in society like the jobs they may have as police, military, doctors, psychiatrists, etc. and the organizations they hide behind like churches, some do-good organizations that are a front, etc.

But that doesn't mean we can't get safe. We absolutely can get safe, remember, talk about the torture and trauma, and learn to treat ourselves kindly and with compassion. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: Would you be interested in in depth videos on cult torture, mind control, DID for a fee? #ramcoa
The four girls who I read to want me to go out with them on Halloween #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, Halloween. The four girls who I read to most nights want me to go with them on Halloween, and I haven't yet decided if I will. I have gone with them before and I can pull on protector parts and mother parts for them and then process the triggers later but it is incredibly triggering. There are so many decorations that people use that are from what happens in cult torture like cut off limbs and bloody hands and people in black cloaks and skeletons and skulls and so much more. They don't know how triggering Halloween is for me and I don't want them to know yet, maybe when they are adults. But it would be spending time with chosen family, with them and their parents. We do have a Superman outfit that our tough guys like and a butterfly-ish fairy outfit that our inner kids and inner fairies like. And if I do go out with them I will have a lot of chocolate afterwards (which I would do anyway) and process the triggers. I crave chocolate a lot more during September and October leading up to Halloween because it was the only positive thing around Halloween that we had as a kid and it does feel like it helps my brain a bit and is comforting. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #plural

episodes.title: The pap smear was incredibly triggering and painful #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture, pap smear, SA, detail. The pap smear yesterday was both incredibly painful and triggering. There's a physiological reason why it's so painful; I have a lot of scar tissue from all the SA and the tools that they used and scar tissue does not stretch and a lot of doctors are unaware of this. And then there is the trigger of SA and how it feels like a violation of the soul and how much I had that happen and how often every day and night of my life for most of my life. Even though she used the child speculum it still hurt so much. 

I did a lot of things to try and help everyone inside and we prepared and yet we still made noise and said that it hurts. We felt so much shame about that because we were taught not to make noise or react through the torture by the cult. And we still don't for most kinds of pain even when it is that bad or worse but we did for this I think because it is so triggering of SA. Like we didn't react when the IV went through our vein recently and we don't react to other forms of pain.

 I think if men had to get pap smears we would already have a painless way to do it and we would have a lot more research. I think anything medical for women or assigned female at birth folks is understudied or not studied at all and I wish it was different. 

 I hurt all day and I bled some and I think it's because she shoved the speculum of me because I wasn't paying and she wanted to get it over with.

So I made sure to have warm tea and a sweet drink afterward and I had a zoom call with some hopeful news and so it wasn't all a hard day. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok #plural

episodes.title: People often think of denial for cult survivors as protective but it can be mind control #ramcoa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, mind control. I often hear survivors and mental health practitioners talking about how denial can be self-protective, and while it absolutely can, while we may not be ready to face certain aspects of the trauma or even our own DID, it can also be programming/mind control. Cults often use mind control to make us doubt ourselves so that we don't talk about it, so that we don't remember more, so that we don't stop them - all programming is about what will benefit the cult. So if you hear a lot of messages inside about you made it all up or you're lying or you're just doing it for attention or to manipulate then it may be a good idea to consider if it is programming and to counteract those messages. Nobody makes up the trauma that we live with, the body memories, the visual flashes, all the many many effects of the trauma including being DID or dissociative, the effects in our bodies and all the triggers we love with and hard times of year based on cult calendars,  nobody lives in the depression and despair and anxiety and trauma that we live in without there being a root cause. We can use denial intentionally if we need to to get through but it can also be really important to see if it is programming and to talk to the folks inside who hold that or to counter the messages. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #mindcontrol #plural #dissociativeidentitydisorder

episodes.title: I was up in the night with anxiety and folks talking aloud; it's a hard time of year #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: Dissociative Identity. TW: cult torture. I was up in the middle of the night with anxiety and racing thoughts and some folks inside talking aloud to me because it is a hard time of year and it gets harder at night. I had kids saying out loud to everyone else that we needed to sleep, and then I had a male inner folk talk in a deep male voice saying that he wanted to die. That is programming but I'm guessing it's also how he felt during the torture and how so many folks inside felt during the torture. So I invited him to talk to me by writing or drawing or talking out loud to me. It is important to do but it is a lot easier to do with the support of a good therapist; it is harder on our own but it is still possible. But I was so glad that he talked a lot to me in his own voice because some parts inside especially with programming try to make their voices sound like my voice or my thoughts so that I won't question it as much and believe it more. I've also noticed that some folks inside get hyperfocused at night before bed or try to drag out the bedtime because night time is scary because that's when more of the formal rituals and torture happened. #cultsurvivor #mindcontrol #plural #dissociativeidentitydisorder

episodes.title: A mental health coach recently consulted me about mind control and DID #cultsurvivor #plural
People ask me how to spot cult members but they mask so well #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture. People who are not cult torture survivors often ask me how to identify cult members. But it is hard to do if you are not a cult torture survivor. 

Cult members are so good at masking. They have good jobs, they volunteer in society, they generally know the right things to say to a degree. They do lack compassion and empathy but can fake it to some degree but that is not enough on its own. 

They are usually very misogynist, homophobic, transphobic, racist, ableist, but that is not enough on its own; our society is steeped in that and most folks have to unlearn that on some level. They use cues but that is something a cult survivor would recognize and many of the cues are things that are used commonly in our society including some specific body language. 

What may help more is looking for the victims, the body language, the signs and symptoms. I have an article on the signs and symptoms of cult torture survivors on my website but it is very detailed so it helps to be in a good place if you read it. 

There needs to be better education about cult torture and DID in society, more people who could hear and believe us, more therapists who are educated about cult torture and DID and therapy that is accessible, since so many survivors can't afford it. There needs to be better laws (the legal system you currently protects perpetrators not victims) and a more compassionate society. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok #traumahealing

episodes.title: My DID was a creative, intelligent way to survive torture & cult-created parts also kept us alive
episodes.description:
Dissociative Identity. TW: cult torture. I strongly believe that my dissociative identity was and is an incredibly creative, intelligent coping mechanism to survive ongoing torture and trauma. I could not have survived without it, and there is so much creativity in our inner worlds. Most of my system is made up of folks that we created ourselves.

I also have cult-created and cult-trained parts who were taught to hurt me and others inside, keep us silent, and when we were still being tortured to report back to the cult. But those cult-created, cult-trained parts were also created to keep me alive. The cult would not have allowed us to survive if they had not been able to create cult-created folks with jobs to hurt, control, and silence us. So it was still about survival. 

And those cult-created folks inside experienced some of the worst and most ongoing torture and mind control and allowed the rest of us to survive, and it is working with them with compassion and empathy and respect and challenging them about the lies the cult told them that has allowed them to change inside from their cult-created jobs to becoming protectors. 

The problems that I have like the triggers in the world are from the torture that was done to us, not from the dissociative identity. The dissociative identity is what kept us alive and allowed us to keep hold of our sanity and compassion and empathy and even our trauma memories and helped us to stay alive, and I am so grateful for everyone inside. we have intercooperation and intercommunication and functional dissociative identity. #plural #systok #cultsurvivor #dissociativeidentity  #dissociativeidentitydisorder

episodes.title: The dentist was triggering but folks inside tried to show up #cultsurvivor #plural
episodes.description: Dissociative Identity. TW: mention of torture, dentist. We got through the dentist yesterday but it was more triggering than usual likely because of time of year and some external factors that are making things harder right now. I did all the things I said I'd do to ground and to help, and my ToughGuys were showing everybody inside that they were there and present and protecting us, and still I had little kids inside really triggered and scared saying that they didn't want to be there and they wanted to go home. So I asked someone inside who blows bubbles to transport folks inside to inner lands that were safe and farther away from the front and the awareness. But we still had to keep dealing with triggers. We made sure to rest and have a few treats when we got home. I hope that you can also draw on coping skills and rest and give yourself treats after a triggering or hard experience. #cultsurvivor #plural #systok  #dissociativeidentitydisorder

episodes.title: The cult frequently gaslit us in the abuse and in "everyday" time #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: Dissociative Identity. TW: cult torture, gaslighting. Something the cult did to me both in everyday time which is what I call he fragments of none abuse  time I had, and in the cult torture was gaslight us, tell us that what happened didn't really happen, make us doubt our reality. In everyday time I was able to prove it a few times with photos. But in the cult torture it would be things like "Oh no, you never met a doctor who experimented on you." "Oh no you never knew this child (who was murdered); they never existed. You made it all up; it's only in your imagination." And this would create internal fighting between the inner folks who went through those experiences and the ones who were given the new reality. This was intentional on the part of cult to make us doubt our own memories and reality, keep us from talking and try to discredit us. Some folks inside see it as something so little because it was not the torture but it was a mind f*ck and it did have an impact. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok #plural #systok

episodes.title: Dealing with triggers around the dentist and dental trauma #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, dental. I have a dentist appointment today which is incredibly triggering because my father and other cult used dental tools on me for torture - it can cause extreme pain with the nerves without being something that most people see. There were actual gouges in my teeth that my first dentist found before I ground them down because I grind my teeth at night. I do many things to cope and try to make it easier. Beforehand with my dissociative identity I tell anyone inside who doesn't want to be there that they don't have to, and I intentionally draw on protector parts of me as well as some parenting parts and wise ones. I take Arnica 30 CH which is homeopathic remedy for triggers before I go. I bring my safe bag with little superhero figures and things for all the senses that are calming or grounding for me. I have a superhero figure in my pocket and I hold it during the appointment, and a stone and a weighted sand filled toy in my other pocket that feels grounding. I get them to put on the weighted apron that is for x-rays because the weight helps me be calmer. I wear superhero socks to make us feel like we have armor and sometimes I visualize having armor or white or gold light around us. We may dissociate a little bit on purpose or because we are so triggered but we don't lose time and we're still aware we're at the dentist. We remind ourselves that this is the present not the past and he's not going to intentionally hurt us. I wear a fidget ring and fidget with it. And I work on my writing or read a book in the waiting room because it helps to calm me down. Those are some things that help me that might help you, too if you have similar experiences. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok #traumahealing

episodes.title: The cult deliberately tried to stamp out all compassion #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture. In the cult torture I survived with the intergenerational, interconnected KKK, Nazi, and Satanic cults that my parents and extended family were a part of, I saw them deliberately and calculatedly try to stamp out all compassion and empathy from us kids and make us harden our hearts, try to force us to enjoy hurting each other or at least be devoid of emotion, and become replicas of the cult, become cult members when we were adults. It was deliberate, extreme, and calculated and I saw so many kids become like the cult and make the choice to enjoy it or to seek out hurting others because that meant they got hurt less and they gained more benefits in the cult torture. But there were always some of us who fought back in the ways we could. And I believe that there is hope and healing for those who could keep hold of some compassion. But I don't believe that most of cult ever can; they do not have any compassion or empathy like my parents and extended family. 

To get safe I believe it is important to remember who our abusers are and cut off contact with them, have internal cooperation and communication so that we can remember and retain the information and work on our healing. Compassion and empathy can cut through hate and mind control programming and be so powerful. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumahealing #traumatok

episodes.title: If you're also a cult survivor who experienced mind control you may want to read my article #ramcoa
The naturopath who does my IV learned about high pain tolerance in cult survivors this week
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. The naturopath who did my IV learned about high pain tolerance in cult torture survivors this week. She put in my IV and it seemed all good and I was working on my book. Part way through I noticed an intense stinging sensation, but it wasn't really high pain and it wasn't torture pain and I didn't want to bother her for that. But when she came in when it was almost done I mentioned it and she got me a hot pack, and then later when she was about to remove things she said "Oh Cheryl, you have such a high pain tolerance. We've never seen such a big lump," where it went through into my flesh; it was about the size of three golf balls but not as high. She kept repeating in a shocked voice that I had such a high pain tolerance. I did not understand why she was shocked when I have told her I'm a cult torture survivor and I have a high pain tolerance. I asked her what normal people would have done and she said they would have been banging on the bell repeatedly after the first or second drop went through. I still didn't understand her shock because I thought I'd been very clear so I asked my friend who's also a cult torture survivor and she said the naturopath has probably only seen regular people's high pain tolerance which is very different from a cult torture survivor's high pain tolerance, and maybe it was the first time she'd seen that. I am trying to be more in my body and if it had been my regular naturopath who I feel really safe with I think I would have been able to tell her sooner. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: Electroshock is one of the common forms of torture cult uses #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
I have a pap smear coming up that I am dreading #cultsurvivor #csa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, SA, detail. I have a pap smear coming up that I am absolutely dreading. It triggers so much of the sexual assault for me, where the men were rough and tore me, where the women used tools and daggers, and where I have so much internal scarring. Scar tissue doesn't stretch, and I can't relax or unclench for a pap smear which means it hurts more. And the more I am in my body since I have been safe the less I can completely dissociate and I start to react more and I find that hard. My doctor knows I'm a cult torture and sexual assault survivor and she tries to do the least possible and it still hurts so much. So I will take a Hulk toy and hold it, I may try to dissociate some and I will try to remind myself it's the present not the past. But I still find it really really triggering but it is good to do for our health. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: One of the grotesque things cult did was drink our blood #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, detail. One of the grotesque things that cult would do is drink our blood. Drink my blood, drink that of other child victims, even of people that they murdered. They said that it gave them control over our souls, and that it gave them vitality and energy. I don't know that the cult actually believed that it gave them control over our souls or gave them more energy or life force, but it was grotesque and something I wanted to run away from and couldn't, and it's hard to know the truth (that it's just torture, nothing all powerful) when you're a child being overwhelmed by torture. I also think it is something that the cult does to try to discredit us if we remember and talk, that people wouldn't believe. But it is a common thing that cult does and it is grotesque. I struggle especially this time of year because closer to Halloween there are so many decorations and imagery about blood. but I struggle all year with it. I can't and drink anything that is liquidy red. And that is only one fragment of what the cult regularly did. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: The cult had total control over what we wore or didn't in the torture #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture, trafficking. Someone asked me once in the comments what I wore in the cult torture. I didn't wear anything. I didn't have a choice; the cult didn't allow me to. Being naked automatically put us victims in a power imbalance where the abusers wore cloaks or clothes and we, being naked, were objectified, were seen only as tools that they could use for their own pleasure for the SA or the torture, but also to allow them easier and faster access and to see what they were doing for the torture. 

The only time I remember them allowing us to wear clothes was for the trafficking when the people who rented us, mostly men but some women, chose the costumes that would titillate them or please them the most. And when the cult would take us to private businesses or homes we wore regular clothes out in the world. 

So it is a taking back of power now to choose the kind of clothes that make us feel the best and the strongest. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #trafficking #traumatok

episodes.title: As cult torture survivors there are many variations on mind control to keep us silent #ramcoa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, mind control. As cult torture survivors there are so many levels of programming to keep us silent, from the common base program of they will kill us if we talk, or torture us or kill someone else, to the programming where they teach us that we will hurt or kill or make sick someone else just by talking about our trauma. But talking about our trauma can be healing, It does not make anyone sick or hurt or kill them, get a man increase their empathy, and it can also help them in the future with other survivors. It can be healing when we speak out. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok #mindcontrol

episodes.title: Cult tries to make us survivors mistrust or even hate each other #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. Cult deliberately tries to divide us survivors, to make us mistrust or even hate each other in the cult torture, by forcing us to torture each other or sexually assault each other, by blaming one of us for the torture of each other or even the murder of another survivor. They do this in the torture and the mind control. They also try to encourage that mistrust of each other in everyday time because when we talk with each other it can be incredibly powerful and healing and validating, and we can understand each other on a level that other people can't. We can help each other know that we're not crazy the way it cult says we are, that we didn't hallucinate anything, that it happened. We can put together pieces faster and heal faster with each other. And I find it strange that in psychiatry they don't want people who are plural or DID talking with each other when the same thing can happen, we can help each other heal better and faster and we can understand each other on a deep level. And so many of us with DID are cult torture survivors. I wish that they would encourage instead of dissuade us to talk to each other because we can find so much healing that way, especially when we find other survivors that are on the same level that we are. There are online groups in newsletters for cult torture survivors and folks living with DID, and there's also many of us on social media where even if we don't personally interact we can learn from each other. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok #systokdid #plural

episodes.title: Cult uses so many objects, sounds etc. from everyday life in torture and mind control
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. Cult deliberately used so many everyday objects, sounds (including popular songs and nursery rhymes), smells, taste, etc in the mind control and the torture to set up triggering off common mind control messages that we must stay silent, that the cult is all powerful, that we are not safe, and also to trigger emotional flashbacks of terror, fear, pain, guilt to overwhelm us. There are so many of them that it can feel overwhelming and we can't avoid all the triggers. But if we can talk through the triggers with someone who is compassionate and caring, if we can remind ourselves that this is the present not the past, I think that can help a lot, and we can reclaim some of the triggers or things used in cues. For me especially I find it incredibly helpful to be able to talk it through with someone who is compassionate and caring and who can hear us. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: I believe love & compassion are stronger & more powerful than hateful mind control #cultsurvivor
Today cult survivors may post art or poetry about the ones who didn't make it #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture. Today is the day cult torture survivors, if we want to, can post poetry or art about the ones who didn't make it in the cult torture, using the hashtag #grievingtogetherRAMCOA organized by system_of_gardens_and_flowers and pluralpages on Insta, and where we can choose if we want to to have our work published in a book where the proceeds will go to an organization that supports cult survivors (link in system of garden's bio).

 I posted a poem about Judy, my grief and pain and trauma, but also healing and speaking out for her and for myself and for all the kids who didn't make it. I believe if Judy was here today she would be speaking out with me. But she was murdered and so I am speaking out for her, for the ones who didn't make it, for other survivors and for myself in the ways I can. 

Judy is the only kid I remember who looked at me in the eyes when we were being forced to torture and assault each other for the pornography, the prostitution, the cult's pleasure, the training us to lose our compassion and to become replicas of cult, and apologized to each other with our eyes and whispered words and touches. We tried over and over to protect each other even though we both got tortured more for it. I loved her and I felt her love for me.

 I believe when we speak out it can be healing and powerful for ourselves, and for other survivors, and encourage healing for others and greater awareness. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #ramcoasurvivor #traumatok

episodes.title: Everything the cult did was deliberate to control & silence us #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. Everything that the cult did was intentional and deliberate, based on psychological research, experiments, knowledge handed down to control us, to make us compliant, to keep us from talking, to make us believe that the cult had complete control over our life or death, to make us believe that we could not escape or get safe. They repeatedly use it bringing us to the point of death or making us think that they did and then bringing us back to show us how much control they had over our life and death and telling us that only the cult would bring us back as long as we stayed loyal to them. But the cult lies. The cult is not all powerful. We can get safe, we can talk about what happened to us, we can heal and work on our healing. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: The harder a time I have the more I numb out of my body because that's how I survived #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. I've been having a harder time lately because it's a hard time of year  and it means that I am more dissociated and out of my body especially if I'm with someone and I don't feel safe with them. It is hard for me to not numb out of my body when there is pain because that is how I survived the torture and it was most of my life. And it is hard for me to take care of my body other than exercising and eating healthy and taking supplements because I was never taken care of except for brusquely after torture when it was in areas that they didn't want people to see or they wanted to make sure that I was still servicible for the trafficking. But I am working on being more in my body because it is healthier and I hope you can, too. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa  #traumatok

episodes.title: I never thought I would live to be an adult #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok
The cult tried to convince us they were all powerful #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, detail. The cult had complete control over our lives and yet they still tried to convince us that they were all powerful and that they had control even over our souls by consuming our blood and even the placenta of forced birthings. But the cult lies. They are not all powerful and we can get safe. I did even though it took most of my life. It helps to have inner communication with the DID, inner cooperation, co-consciousness, someone safe like a therapist or a friend, remembering and cutting off contact with abusers. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: I think it is a problem trauma-informed therapy is so hard for many people to access #cultsurvivor
As a cult torture survivor it is hard for me to set boundaries #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. As a cult torture survivor it is really hard for me to say no and to set boundaries because I was never allowed to and I was taught the opposite. The cult thought that they owned my body and everything about me for the trafficking and for their own SA and torture of me, and every aspect of my life was controlled. And when I did resist to try and protect other kids they tortured those kids more, or killed some, and tortured me more, and those were heavy teachings to not say no. And then they taught me through specific mind control messages which are negative messages paired by torture that I didn't have a choice and I always had to submit, and they continuously put me in the victim position after they saw that I would not become like them. They controlled my life in so many extreme ways with so much torture so it can be hard for me to say no or set boundaries if I don't feel safe. But I have been learning to more and more and I recently did with someone twice where I set a boundary and then they pushed through it again and I setit again - and I feel proud of myself that I did that. it is much easier to set boundaries or say no or ask for what I need when I feel safe with someone, but I am learning to do it more. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: It can be really hard to trust as a cult torture survivor  #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
Peer support can be so incredibly healing #traumahealing #cultsurvivor #dissociativeidentity
I think I'll always be healing. #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor
I've been having needle body memories #cultsurvivor  #ramcoa
Some ways I recognize old mind control messages from cult to SH or unalive self #cultsurvivor
It's September and I am already having a hard time as a #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, Halloween, detail. It's September and I am already having a hard time around Halloween because in cult.torture they increase the torture and mind control starting from September all the way up to Halloween. There are so many things that are in Halloween costumes and decorations out in the world that are actually used in cult torture and that can bring us back down to the memories and trauma, incmuding skulls, cut off body parts, spiders, black cloaks, masks, and more. It is a really rough time of year for me and for many other cult torture survivors. (Some detail in video). So if you know a cult torture survivor you might want to check in with them or offer to hear them if they want to talk or just be gentle with them. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: I was trafficked most of my life by the cult #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #trafficking
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, trafficking, detail. I was trafficked most of my life by the cult - as a child, as a teen, and even as an adult because I was still being tortured by them. As a child they used stories to entice mostly white het cis men to rent me, like that I was a virgin even though I have been SAed since I was a baby, but many men liked that story. I knew I was queer when I was about five or six; I just didn't have the language, but as a tween I could say I was lesbian and then the cult used that as a story to entice men to rent me, saying that they could turn me straight by SAing me. All of that created such psychological damage and some physical as well. It impacted my body image, my sense of self, my sense of safety, and more. And when I am really aware of the memories or triggered into it I can think about how men who rented me  might pass me in the street and they know what my body looks like and what they did to me, and I can feel ashamed even though the shame is not mine to hold. I wish we had such better supports in our society for survivors, and better interventions and more trauma-informed training. I am so grateful to be safe now and I wish safety and healing for all of us survivors. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #trafficking #traumatok

episodes.description: TW: cult torture. When I was a kid being tortured by the cult I thought that every adult was cult because that was mostly my experience. There were a lot of cult members who lived on the street I grew up in, so many of them in the church, there was at least one cult member at every school that I went to who would report back on me, and in the very few extracurricular activities my parents allowed me to go to there was always a cult member. My parents' friends were cult. And if they weren't cult then they were someone I was trafficked to. I also thought this because the cult told me that they were everywhere, all powerful, all hearing and all seeing and they made me believe this through different abuse scenarios. But I did have a gut sense that a few people might actually be kind, and I also gained hope through books and movies. I'm glad I held on to that hope that they were safe people in the world and that I found some over time, that there are kind and compassionate people in the world. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: As a cult torture survivor I have a hard time going to the zoo or animal shelters #cultsurvivor
I wish there were more therapists trained to help cult survivors with DID #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: I wish that there was so many more therapists and mental health professionals who were educated about cult torture and DID from cult survivor and DID informed information that didn't pathologize us, and that didn't miss the connections on how cult torture can influence and impact the DID including cult created jobs like having folks inside criticize us or block positives. In between the two good therapists I have had, I had to educate every therapist and it can take up most of the session and feel exhausting and not like therapy. It can be hard to find a good therapist and I know I'll be in that position again. And also it can be a struggle to afford one, especially for those of us with extreme trauma like cult torture and the resulting DID. I'm so grateful for my naturopath and the naturopath students who have been open to me educating them about cult torture and DID and they are kind and compassionate with me and can hear me and believe me, and it is still not therapy, though it is support. I wish there was so much more knowledge about this out in the world that is survivor and DID experience based. I think of my videos and how I educate, and my articles and some things that I put in my books, and I hope it will reach therapists and survivors who need it and also help the general public more. #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor #mentalhealth

episodes.title: I've had to mask as someone who lives with DID #dissociativeidentity #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
Dissociative Identity, Autism. TW: cult torture. I have had to mask a lot of my life as someone who lives with DID and who is also autistic. I was taught to mask by my abusers, by the cult, because they wanted me to look more socially presentable and as if everything is more okay, and if you see someone with DID you know that there is trauma there, and you know if they're switching in and out that there had to be some kind of trauma. I also had a cult-involved partner who did not like the child parts of me fronting so easily and so also increased the torture around that to make us not switch so visibly. 

I also have experienced a lot of bullying in my life and the more I was myself and unmasked the more bullying I would get, both with the dissociative identity and the autism. I have been lucky to have had good therapist who I can completely unmask with and some good friends where I can completely unmask with and then some people in my life where I don't unmask as much but I can still unmask, I can still switch some in and out of folks inside, and also fidget or self soothe by rocking when I need to - I do constant fidgeting even when trying to mask - and I'm really grateful for that because it is exhausting to mask.

But I feel like for me as an author working with my books and with publishers that they need to know that they can depend on me and that I am reliable and that they can work with me and that I'm not a problem, and so then I feel like I have to mask, and I have to show that like I am one instead of all the many fragments of myself, even though I've written a book about it about Dissociative Identity and cult torture (not yet published; it's out with editors) to have them feel more comfortable. I wish that the world was different, that we had more acceptance and compassion automatically for however we present and how we are in the world, and how we need to be; it would be so much less exhausting.

So I am most me when I am around people I feel safe with, layers of safety, and it is so much less exhausting and I am really grateful for it.

But to do these videos I am often me, Cheryl, and author folks inside me, and sometimes wise parts inside me, or mothering or parenting parts inside me to draw on certain wisdom. Then when I am talking about details about cult torture or DID I am drawing on parts of me who are knowledge-based parts who sit way up in my head who aren't as much in the body but who are very knowledge-based and can speak from that experience and speak from that information. I'm blending folks inside together intentionally, or sometimes not intentionally, to present in a way that feels like people can hear me. But I wish I felt free to be all of me all the time because it would be so much less exhausting as long as we had compassion and empathy from other people; it could be so healing. And so those spaces where I actually have that with people feels freeing and healing and wonderful and I'm really grateful for them. #dissociativeidentitydisorder #systok #cultsurvivor #ramcoa

episodes.title: The cult frequently used confinement for psychological and physical torture #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, detail. As a cult torture survivor where confinement was frequently used I have a hard time being in small, confined spaces. The cult frequently used confinement in conjunction with threats of death or that we were already dead to make this both physical and psychological torture such as drugging us up so we were paralyzed, putting us in a coffin and bearing us underground where there was very little air and we could not move. (More examples in video.) Cults do this to threaten and subdue victims because it is a form of isolation, a form of power and control and showing the victim that they have total control over the victims life or death, and a way to encourage splitting with the dissociative identity. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: It can take so long to get safe from cult torture #cultsurvivor #ramcoa
episodes.description: TW: cult torture. I don't think most people realize how hard it is to get safe from cult torture. It took me most of my life, even though I disclosed child sexual abuse at age 13 with a great uncle, I couldn't tell the authorities that my parents were torturing me and other people because I was living with my abusers and they killed kids in front of me and threatened to kill me and I knew they could and would. And then there's all the dissociation and the stuffing down of memories, and all the mind control messages put in there through torture to not remember and to not tell. When I remembered them and what they were doing to me I ran away from home, but they found me and brought me back over and over and over and would torture me at night. I wish that I'd had more support and people who were trauma informed and cult informed who could help, but it can be hard to even have people hear us and believe us. I had to work so hard on inner communication and inner cooperation, to have everyone inside tell me who they remembered were our abusers, cut off contact , and work on the mind control messages. So I am grateful for every one of you who here and believe me and other survivors and then are more aware for other survivors you might come across. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: My parents & other cult abusers taught me to smile most of the time #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor
The cult used needles for physical and psychological torture #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture, detail. The cult frequently used needles for both physical and psychological torture. They used different sizes and thicknesses of needles, most did not have handles, a few did; the ones that did were used to twist to create more pain. The cult was very good at creating the most pain with the least physical visible effect, using different angles and knowing where to put the needles. There were regular men and some women who paid a huge extra fee in the trafficking to be taught torture techniques, and one of the torture techniques was using needles. Some of those people were very clumsy with the needles even though the cult first demonstrated on me then on another kid while the person who paid tried to torture me in the exact same way. Because they were clumsy it was bad in a different way where there was a lot more bleeding, and swelling that the cult had to bring down with ice. The cult is so practiced and deliberate that they don't leave effects like that. The cult also used psychological torture paired with the physical torture for doing things such as temporarily paralyzing my limbs using needles, telling me that they would kill the child in front of me if I didn't take the dagger away, and because I could not move or lift my arms I lunged forward and tried to grab it with my mouth but I could not pull the dagger from him and so he killed the child. That is psychological torture paired with physical torture. Cult always tries to create the most horrific combination of physical and psychological torture that they can. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.description: TW: cult torture. In cult torture silence is the price we pay for our lives. The cult demands silence; it is what allows them to continue, and they reinforce the need for silence in so many different ways, including torture, specific mind control, creation or splitting off of folks inside (dissociative Identity) for specific jobs to keep us silent or keep us from remembering or make us doubt our memories), elaborate abuse scenarios related to talking equals death or pain for us and others, and murder, and more. Survivors speaking out is a huge act of courage, even if it is just to one other person, and can make room for more survivors to be heard and believed, too. And when we are heard with compassion and empathy it helps cut through the mind control. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

episodes.title: In talking about Judy's murder I can release some of the guilt that was never mine #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture. It's raining this morning and it feels like all the tears I can't cry, all the tears that I was taught not to cry by the torture, by the cult, and it gives me a feeling of lightness in my chest, of ease of some of the grief that I hold for so many things that the cult did, but also for the murder of Judy, and for all the other kids.

Since I talked publicly about Judy I have been having so many more memories of her, and in every single memory we fought to protect each other, we fought against the cult even though we both got tortured more, we fought to protect each other. We tried to tell each other in so many ways that we were sorry for what the cult was forcing us to do, that the cult forced us to do to each other and the sexual assaults for the child p0rn0gràphy, and even the murder at the end where the cult forced my six-year-old fingers over the handle of the knife to her neck.

And even then I could see that she knew it was the cult's fault, that they were the ones to blame. Even then I could see her love for me and how we both knew the cult was the one to blame.
 
But for so many years I have held so much guilt in me, in my body, in my emotions, because they told me it was my fault because it was my hand on the handle even though I was 6 years old, and I fought them, but they were adults, adult males, some women. They overpowered me, they overpowered Judy, neither of us could stop it. It wasn't my fault. I can see that in my mind now and through lots of therapy too, it wasn't my fault, it wasn't Judy's fault either for any of what the cult forced us to do to each other, but her murder was not my fault.

 With the memories over & over & over, the connection we had, the soul bond we had, I feel closer to her & I feel the grief more.  

 I think of how the cult intentionally tried to increase the bond between us, & likely partnered us with each other, because we were so similar in how we were the only ones who looked at each other's eyes & would whisper apologies & in our touches & looking at each other with empathy & pain as the cult forced us to do what we did to each other. 

She was the only other kid who did that with me & for me who made me feel seen & loved even in all the evil & the torture that was happening. I think the cult intentionally paired us so that it would be even more trauma when they murdered her, so it would break me & split me more & more & more. Because the cult wanted me to become like them; they wanted me to harden my heart. Judy was unregistered, born into the cult, & so they saw her life as worthless, except for torture, child p0rn0gràphy, & the trafficking, & what they could do to both of us in the end.

But she had so much value. She was my friend, & she was a good soul, a good person. I loved her & I am grateful for her. I think we helped each other feel seen & loved when there was no one else doing that, when it was only torture & evil around us. I'm so grateful for her.

The more I can talk about her the more I can release some of the guilt & the pain. It is still there. It was the cult's fault; I know that & I can see that so clearly for every other survivor who's been through the same thing, but the cult taught us it was our fault in everything they said & did. I think I am releasing it more now & I'm grateful to.

I love her & will never forget her,  & in my saying her name, Judy, other people will not forget her either, & the friendship she gave me & the ways we tried to protect each other & apologize to each other for something that was not our fault, & that matters.

 I hope if you've been through the same or similar things you know it was not your fault either; it was the fault of the cult, the abusers, the tormentors. When we are children we have no power, no control & we are blameless & we are innocent & we are good. #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor #traumatok

There are so many ways and reasons and they are multi-layered including that the cult uses sophisticated mind control paired with torture to keep us silent; cults forcibly birth most of the babies and kids that they murder through cult members who have a uteruses; cult members look and sound respectable and go to church and have upstanding jobs; there are cult members who were police, lawyers, doctors, nurses, teachers etc.; and people are not very observant of trauma and often do not know the signs and do not put them together; and most physical signs are hidden internally or beneath clothes where no one would look, and the psychological signs even though they can be so obvious people aren't aware or they are excused away. And then we live in a society that doesn't even believe folks who speak out about SA. I hope as I speak out and more survivors do that more and more survivors are believed and heard and that awareness is raised and more survivors can get saved sooner. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #traumatok

Things that help me deal with mind control from cult torture (#RAMCOA) #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: mind control from cult torture. when I have mind control happening from the Colts torture the first thing that helps is to recognize that it's happening, so recognize the repeated messages, sometimes in my abusers' voices, to hurt her kill myself, or seeing flashes of myself doing that like close ups which parts of me were taught to do by practicing. Then it helps to directly counteract those messages, remind everyone inside that the cult is cruel and diabolical and evil; everything they taught us is to only benefit them and hurt us and so we want the opposite of them, we want safety and compassion and healing and love. It helps to talk to others inside, to write out opposite messages. It can help to think of and visualize the people we love who we would never ever want to hurt and that can be an extra wall or a last wall. And it can also really help to ask someone safe who we care about to give us counter messages; their compassion and love can cut through the mind control and hate. I also have asked folks inside to counter the messages and alert me when it's happening. and I've also used grounding and calming techniques, and staying in the present, helping folk inside see that this is the present not the past. And reminding folks inside that we don't want to die, we just want things to be happier and easier and find more love and compassion and good. These things help me and I hope they'll help you, too. #cultsurvivor #ramcoa #mindcontrol #traumahealing

episodes.description: TW: cult torture, mind control, su1c1dal ideation. I had a rough mental health day yesterday after I told my naturopath and naturopath student a new-to-me, very painful torture memory. Doing that triggered off old mind control messages to unalive myself (which I will never do), combined with really intense, overwhelming despair, depression, grief. Usually I can recognize mind control going on but I was stuffing it down and having a hard time thinking through it. I used so many coping techniques including tapping, nervous system regulation techniques, homeopathic remedies, grounding, comforting, and it would shift it for a little while and then it would come back just as hard or harder. It took me most of the day to understand why that mind control got triggered - that I told a really painful new trauma memory. Then when I talked to my friend who is also a cult survivor she reminded me it wasn't just the specific trauma memory I told that is so raw and deep and more full than my memories usually are, it was also that I told a helping professional. I have so much mind control against doing that, and I remember very specific things the cult did to keep me from talking especially to any helping professionals. Once I connected it up it helped shift and move it a lot faster. It's still there some today but it's not as bad at all. We *can* move through mind control and old cult messages taught through torture. It helps to have inner communication, inner cooperation, awareness that mind control has been set off, and some support. More detail in my video. #cultsurvivor #mindcontrol #ramcoa

episodes.description:
TW: cult torture, mind control. There are times of year when it feels so hard to get through and I don't know how I will, when the grief and sadness and despair and depression are so strong. I think when that happens I am reliving what I felt during the cult torture, as well as responding to old mind control messages to unalive myself that the cult deliberately gave to specific parts of me (DID). 
There are many ways to help that. One is doing rescue work where I ask folks inside to take me back to when they felt that way, relive the memory with them, then send the abusers away in my memory, comfort the folks inside who were traumatized, give them new messages and ask if they want new jobs, or slowly change how they are in the world or with me. But I can only do that when I'm feeling safe enough. Another way is to write out the old mind control messages or trauma or draw it out. Another is to talk to my therapist or a friend or support who can hear me with compassion and empathy. I also now use nervous system regulation techniques which can help my body feel safe and then folks inside feel safe and remind us that we're not being abused anymore, that we are safe, that we have choices now and can choose to find comfort. Comfort is also another big thing, it can help. I end up having chocolate, hugging squishmallows, hugging a person if I feel safe with them, reading a good book. I think if we're only doing one or very few of those things it makes it harder to get through. like when I was only processing memory all the time I was flooding. I needed to know the information but not in that way; it was overwhelming. But if I only do positive distraction or reassurance the trauma and all the emotion is still sitting there in me and it's not getting out, but a combination of those things helps. I hope these things might help you, too, and that you have support when you need it. #cultsurvivor #didsystem #mindcontrol #ramcoasurvivor #traumahealing

Usually I am so dissociated from it that I can't stay aware of it until maybe the day but I still have a rough time leading up to it and on the day, so this year I am trying to stay more aware of it which is hard. But it was hard even without staying aware; I still had a rough time because of the time of year, and I think it's healthier to stay aware. Mother's Day is hard because of cults use it, increasing the torture, r@pe, and mind control and doing specific things. But it's also always been hard because I had an abusive mother who sexually abused me, physically abused me, psychologically abused me, and of course tortured me. And now this year I have the added awareness of the grief of my mother parts who were forcibly impregnated and forced to bear children in the cult torture and that is an added layer of deep grief. So I am trying to do things to self-soothe, maybe some art, definitely some treats, reading a good book or watching a good show, talking to a good friend about the trauma and to my therapist. I know that Mother's Day is hard for so many people for so many reasons. I hope if it's rough for you too that you also do some things that help you and don't hurt you, or soothing are comforting, that you get some support, and that it is not as hard as it has been before. I wish you good healing. #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor #traumatok #traumahealing #mothersday

episodes.title: I don't believe we need to forgive our abusers to heal #cultsurvivor
episodes.description: TW: cult torture survivor. My neighbour was talking to me about the importance of forgiving even though she knows I'm a cult torture survivor. I don't believe that we need to forgive our abusers to heal. I believe that we need to forgive ourselves for things that we feel responsible for even though they weren't our responsibility, like for me not being able to save other victims while I was being tortured. But I don't believe that we need to forgive our abusers. They chose to abuse and torture and rape and murder. And I have seen great healing in myself over the years without forgiving them. I think forgiveness is like accepting what they did or saying it's okay. If you personally feel like you need to forgive your abusers that is your choice but I think it's important not to push one's belief on anyone else. We each heal in our own way. #cultsurvivor #traumahealing #mentalhealth

episodes.description: TW: cult torture survivor. A few days ago I was having body memories of very specific torture that was done to me by the cult (more details in the video), but I was having trouble figuring out if it was body memory or not, because I used to assume that everything I felt in my body that didn't feel right was body memory because I was having trauma memories all the time, like nausea. But then I found out that some of the problems were physical (gluten intolerance, gall bladder, etc.) and so then I started assuming that everything was physical. But I think some is body memory and some is physical. I talked it through with a survivor friend and I think for me if it goes on for days and days and is a constant or is super intense or always happens around the same time like every night it's probably something to check out with a doctor. But if it comes and goes then it is likely body memory, especially if it is in specific areas where the torture was done and feels like the torture or responss I had to it. I may not have it right but it feels right for me for now. And I think it's always a good idea to check with a doctor. #cultsurvivor #traumatok #ramcoasurvivor #traumahealing

My cult abusers tried to make me like them but they couldn't. #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture survivor. 
When I was a child being tortured by my cult abusers, including my parents, I couldn't understand how they could enjoy and get off on my pain and my terror and that of the other kids. I still don't understand it. They were trying to make me like them, they were trying to mold me into their image and make me lack compassion and empathy and make me enjoy others' pain and they couldn't do it.

 I remember being about five maybe six, on an altar being r@ped and looking up at my r@pist, my abuser who was enjoying my pain and terror, who was getting off on it so much, and the cries of other kids being r@ped and tortured and abused, and thinking "I will never be like you, I choose to be the opposite of you." They tortured me more, they increased the mind control more, they forced me to do horrific things, but they couldn't make me like them, they couldn't take away my good soul. 

I kept splitting off parts of myself, some to do what they were forcing me to do so I wouldn't lose my innocence and my sanity, so that I could survive and live, but I also created parts of me to heal and work on healing, to try and get safe. 

There were parts of me who would try and protect the other kids and even adults, protect them or help them in the ways that I could, and the cult could not stamp that out. Eventually they realized that and instead of trying to force me to be an abuser they kept putting me in the role of victim every time. But that didn't change it for me, my desire to get safe, my desire to heal, my desire to help others; they couldn't stamp that out. 

They tried with everything in them; that included deliberate mind control and torture and skewed abuse scenarios, and they still couldn't do that, they still couldn't make me like them. That was true for me and for many other kids, though there were also many kids who did become like them and took their place or stood alongside them to enjoy torturing and murdering and r@ping other people. 

But just because we've been tortured or abused and deliberately put on the path of becoming like our abusers doesn't mean we become like them. We can fight back in all the ways we can, we can work on healing and getting safe, and then when we're safe we have even more choice and more ways to put good in the world and to protect ourselves and others. I hope you know that and you see that in yourself too. #cultsurvivor #traumatok #didsystem #dissociativeidentity #ramcoa

Today is DID Awareness Day. #dissociativeidentitydisorder #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: cult torture survivor. Today is Dissociative Identity Disorder Awareness Day or DID Awareness Day. DID is much more common than many people think, and you may know someone in your life who lives with it. I'm Cheryl Rainfield, author of SCARS, STAINED, HUNTED, VISIONS, and I live with polyfragmented DID as a direct result of the cult torture that I survived as a child, as a teen, as an adult. The parts of me were created as a child and a teen, but some even in later years as the torture continued. DID is not crazy; it is a creative, intelligent way of coping with extreme, ongoing childhood torture and abuse and mind control, a way to escape when we couldn't physically escape, when there was no other way to escape except for splitting off parts in the mind. And that's a huge part of how I survived and how I kept my sanity and how I kept my good soul intact.

For me it's been really important to work on inner cooperation and inner communication, and working with other parts inside of me, making sure that I and all parts of me are aware that it's the present and what's going on in the outside world. So I don't lose time anymore, but I worked for a long time to do that, and to work with everyone inside. It also helps me to do rescue work with parts of me, to listen to when they were created and how they were created, like the abuse or torture event, and then to go back and visualize saving them from that and helping them learn a new job if the job or the role that they have is not healthy one. 

Because I am a cult torture survivor, not all the parts of me were created by me; there are some parts of me that cult intentionally to have very specific jobs and roles that they wanted, like having parts of me who would deny the memories, the abuse and trauma, who would make me doubt it, would keep me from remembering or keep me from talking, or who would hurt me emotionally or physically. Those are very specific jobs that the cult created in me and wanted, and it is common for cult torture survivors who have DID to have some of those jobs or roles inside. It helps so much to work with those parts of us, and to see that they're not scary; they were created because they had to or the cult would have continued and increased the torture and mind control, so it was survival. So their root or their true role underneath it all Is to protect us and help us survive and get through. So when you know that it helps; it helps make it so much easier to work with them even though they can put up a tough facade.

 I hope that if you know someone who has DID that you will listen to their experience, because everyone's experience can be a little or a lot different, and also read a book about it, or watch some videos, or read some articles. It helps to have people who could hear in a real way. #didawareness #dissociativeidentitydisorder #cultsurvivor #multiplepersonalities #ramcoasurvivor

The people who say "satanic panic" are using the same language my cult abusers did. #cultsurvivor
episodes.description:
TW: satanic cult torture survivor.  The people that are saying that cult abuse is not real, that satanic cult abuse is not real, that it's all "satanic panic" and conspiracy theories, and where's the evidence, are using the same language that our cult abusers used, and that abusers use, and that's not a side that I would want to be on. I'm Cheryl Rainfield, author of SCARS, STAINED, HUNTED, VISIONS, and I am a satanic cult torture survivor as well as a survivor of the KKK and Nazi Cults and some other smaller ones. My parents were part of intergenerational, interconnected cults, and so were my entire extended family and many of their friends. I am lucky to be alive and I am grateful to be alive.  

So some people ask where is the proof? First of all I think you should believe survivors when we speak out; it is horrific and painful and hard to talk about and we are some of the most silenced survivors in society. People so often don't want to believe even rape; they have trouble believing cult torture. Many of us survivors have internal scarring, where it wouldn't show, where most people wouldn't see, but my doctor found it. I had gouges in my teeth from when my father and other abusers used dental tools on me for torture, which my dentist found, which I have now ground down because of how many years I've been grinding my teeth. 

There is the truth in our words, and our memories, and our trauma. I would not have DID, dissociative identity disorder, without haven't had to split off parts of myself to survive the torture and the mind control, and having my cult abusers specifically, deliberately create splits and parts of me to take on jobs that they wanted those parts of me to take on, like finding ways to hurt myself emotionally and shut myself up and keep myself quiet. Those are very standard jobs cult abusers give us. I would not have the c-ptsd, the trauma, the triggers that plague me almost every day, the triggers down to trauma memories, the debilitating way that trauma memories can take me over and the effects of trauma, so many effects of trauma everyday and every night of my life. I have shown so many signs of abuse and extreme abuse and torture my entire life, and teachers and other people were usually concerned but didn't understand what they were seeing and didn't recognize it. 

When we tell you that we have been through torture we mean actual torture - physical torture, sexual torture, psychological torture. Satanic cult abuse is real, and there are so many survivors. Cult abuse is real and there are so many survivors. I call it cult torture because it was torture. We are here and I hope that you believe us and I hope that you don't fall into the trap that abusers want you to and use the phrases "satanic panic" or "conspiracy theories" to talk about satanic cult torture survivors. Thank you for listening. #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor #believesurvivors

episodes.title: please believe satanic cult survivors and don't use the term satanic panic to try to discredit us
episodes.description:
TW: satanic cult torture survivor.
There is a creator on tiktok, a fellow author, who is trying to discredit satanic cult survivors, saying that it is all "satanic panic" and conspiracy theories, and that there was no evidence.

You may know me, I am Cheryl Rainfield, author of SCARS, STAINED, HUNTED, VISIONS, and I have been open since I was a teen about being a cult torture survivor. My parents and extended family were part of intergenerational, interconnected cults, and that included satanic, KKK, and Neo Nazi and some other smaller cults. This was incredibly organized and intentional. It was torture and mind control and trafficking. It was horrific and I'm really grateful to be alive.

I believe other survivors. I think it is so important to believe and hear other survivors. I think it's important to lift up voices of survivors. I know how hard it can be for people to hear and believe, to want to believe in our "civilized" society that these horrific things happen. I think about how hard it is for so many people to believe a woman who's been raped, how many people try and tear her apart and say that she's lying, child sexual abuse survivors. Then you go to the extreme organized cult torture that happens in our society - people don't want to listen or believe, but it's real and it happens. There is proof.

But organized cults like this make it very hard persona virus to be believed and to see evidence but there is evidence. Go to website ra-info.org and also traumadissociation.com, and you will find links to and discussion about cases where they have found evidence of satanic cult abuse such as the McMartin case where they found tunnels and bones and cauldrons exactly where the kids of the daycare said they would be. That is eerily reminiscent of the tunnels that have been found under some Hollywood homes and extreme abuse that is very close to or is cult torture that is coming out about P Diddy and associates.

I'm going to talk about some detail about cult torture; it may be hard to hear and so if you don't want to hear please scroll away. One thing that cults do to try and destroy evidence and make sure that kids and teens and adults survivors when they speak out are not believed, is that they force us victims to ingest the flesh of people who were murdered, to get rid of a lot of evidence (and traumatize us more). It is done in many different ways including grinding up the bones.

Another thing that makes it harder for people to find evidence  is that in organized cult torture like I survived with satanic, KKK, and Nazi every person who is born assigned female at birth  or with a uterus is forced to bear a  child or children, usually multiple children, for the cult. The babies are usually born early, they are not registered in hospitals, they're not born in hospitals, they are born in cult settings and they are grown up to the age they are allowed to live. They are kept in cult settings only where they don't go to school, they don't have access to other things and then those kids are killed. That is a huge part of the murder that happens, the torture.

There are also a lot of people in positions of power; I remember police officers, social workers, judges, lawyers, doctors, and nurses, and they all worked in conjunction with each other so that there was as little possible evidence to be found, except of course in our bodies, and to help keep us silent. 

Organized cults build on years and years of torture and mind control techniques to keep us silent, and so speaking out is so incredibly hard. I  hope that you can believe and hear survivors, and hold space for us even though it is so much pain and trauma. I think it's so important that we believe survivors, support survivors, and that we don't try and tear other survivors down.

 I'm also very aware that in the organized cult torture, the satanic, KKK, and Nazi, that our abusers did sometimes dress up as police and doctors and nurses and teachers to try and make us be afraid of those people in positions of power and to keep us from talking. It was very intentional. But there were also cult members who had those professions in society.

I don't believe that my cult abusers  actually believed in Satanism; I think they used the language and the clothing that they wore, and the religious artifacts, to try and discredit us more when we would actually talk because who wants to believe that? And to create more fear. And for Satanism they used Christianity in an upside down way and they used many of the same religious holidays and that makes it even more triggering for a cult torture survivors because there is a constant bombardment of language that is used in cult torture that is in our society and built into our society and our holidays.

 I hope you believe and listen to and support survivors and that you don't use phrases like satanic panic or conspiracy theories.

Thank you for hearing me. #cultsurvivor #ramcoasurvivor #believesurvivors
